page.title: 19OLD DOVE HOLES.
page.content: Fred Hill remembers the Peak Forest Tramway working between Dove Holes & Buxworth.It carried limestone to the canal basin.Fred's father was a chauffeur at Bibbington Hall & drove the first car in Dove holes in l910 (a Singer).He also remembers Louis Bleriot giving a demonstation flight over Fairfield Common. Mr Cottrill's family have been in the village for 200 years as joiners, builders & funeral directors. He remembers gas light coming to the village.Mugs were given out at school for the Silver Jubilee of King George V & all the children had to wear black armbands when he died.Three large quarries worked in the village making it a busy place (and dusty).All the work was done by hand even the pushing of the laden wagons.
